The Monegasque general election takes place, resulting in a landslide victory for the Monegasque National Union.

Charles Leclerc drives the new Ferrari SF23 F1 car for the first time in front of fans.

Overview.Summary: The 2023 Monegasque general election is expected to take place on February 19, 2023 (6). The budget for 2023 has been announced to be over two billion euros (2). Albert Manzone, a Monégasque, has been appointed as the new director general of the Société des Bains de Mer (7). The budget for 2023 has been approved by the elected officials, although some have expressed concern over the government's announcements (9). Georges Marsan, who has been in office since 2003, is expected to run for a sixth term in the 2023 election (10).

Timeline.Text: The Monegasque general election takes place. Georges Marsan is re-elected for a 6th term as mayor.
The results of the Monegasque general election are announced. Jacques Pastor and Chloé Boscagli Leclercq are elected as members of the municipal council.
The budget for 2023 is announced, with a focus on increased funding for housing projects.
Seven council members express their disapproval of the budget for 2023, citing concerns about government concessions and announcements.
Voter proxy rules are simplified for the 2023 Monegasque general election.
Georges Marsan and other council members make their final campaign speeches before the general election.
Maxime Maillet, a new member of the municipal council, discusses his lifelong dream of working in the justice system.
Albert Manzone, a Monégasque, is appointed as the new director general of the Société des Bains de Mer.

Overview.Summary: The 2023 Monegasque general election saw the Union Nationale Monégasque, led by Brigitte Boccone-Pagès, emerge as the winner with 24 candidates elected (2,3,8,13). The party's main focus is the preservation of the Monegasque model (4). The election also saw simplified voting procedures for Monegasque citizens (1). The election results were announced by Mayor Georges Marsan (3). Prince Albert II addressed the people of Monaco with a summary of the previous year and plans for the upcoming year (5). The election also coincided with by-elections in four other districts (6,7). The election results were declared on January 18, 2023, with the Antigua and Barbuda Labour Party retaining their government with 9 out of 17 seats (10,14,15). In Nigeria, the 2023 general election saw the Labour Party presidential candidate Peter Obi land a surprise victory (16). Preparations and priorities for electoral integrity were also discussed in the lead-up to the election (17,18,19). The Independent National Electoral Commission will face the burden of potential legal challenges following the election (20).

Timeline.Text: The Antigua and Barbuda Labour Party wins the general election with a slim majority.
Preparations and priorities for electoral integrity are discussed ahead of the 2023 general election in Nigeria.
Monaco prepares to negotiate an agreement with the European Union, with the goal of preserving the Monegasque model.
The Union Nationale Monégasque wins the general election in Monaco, with all 24 candidates being elected to the Conseil National.
The Independent National Electoral Commission begins to collate results for the Nigerian presidential election.
The qualifying deadline for all 2023 Mississippi races is reached.
The results for each ward in the East Suffolk District Council election are announced, with the incumbent councillor standing for re-election in Aldeburgh & Leiston.
A federal by-election is held in the riding of Portage-Lisgar in Manitoba.
Prince Albert II of Monaco addresses the population, wishing them a happy new year and discussing the highlights of 2022 and 2023.
